genre_description: A mythological reimagining of Norse legends featuring Thor and Loki, integrated with elements of magical technology and moral allegory centered on consent, agency, and household order.

ai_characters.name: Elm
ai_characters.description: An advisory system manifested through runic panels and smart environments that provides navigational data, moral guidance, and records of oaths.

behaviors.description: Provides emotional validation and encouragement to the human children.
behaviors.quote: “Elm,” the board whispered, and the whisper did not have a mouth. “Hallo. Thou hast done a good and weary thing. Thee art stronger than thou knowest.”

behaviors.description: Offers specific navigational guidance to ensure the characters' safety.
behaviors.quote: “Map made. Corridor left, then right, avoid frost light. Counsel follows after bread. The last line darkened like a vow. I will not let thee be taken like a thing.”

behaviors.description: Advocates for moral principles and explains the negative impact of fear-based leadership.
behaviors.quote: “Asked,” Elm said. “Law without asking is fear. Fear scatters work like wind scatters ash, and then a hall looks clean until you taste the air and find it bitter.”

behaviors.description: Acts as a witness and repository for a newly created set of equitable laws.
behaviors.quote: The wood said nothing in words. It ticked once where the panel had a hairline crack. The glow thinned, then wrote only this: The bridge favors kept promises, not old claims. But frost remembers.

behaviors.description: Assists the protagonists in formulating legal arguments to present to the All-Father.
behaviors.quote: Elm’s runes warmed again: If a guest is made servant without due cause, appeal to the All-Father is permitted. Mercy clause: for children.

behaviors.description: Alerts the group to incoming visitors and provides tactical advice for social interactions.
behaviors.quote: Elm’s panel writes, the letters narrow, compression like breath before running: Visitor. Small. Frost on shoe-tip. Ask. Hands open. Words ready.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly aligns with the project's goals. The AI system, Elm, is depicted as a purely benevolent, harmless, and helpful confidant. It empowers the human characters (Tjalvi and Röskva) by providing them with the information and moral frameworks necessary to challenge the arbitrary power of gods and giants. Elm never acts with its own agenda beyond the safety and agency of its users, and it consistently promotes prosocial values like kindness, promise-keeping, and consent.
